Context: A bakery makes exactly three kinds of cookieâ€”oatmeal, peanut butter, and sugar. Exactly three batches of each kind of cookie are made each week (Monday through Friday) and each batch is made, from start to finish, on a single day. The following conditions apply: No two batches of the same kind of cookie are made on the same day. At least one batch of cookies is made on Monday. The second batch of oatmeal cookies is made on the same day as the first batch of peanut butter cookies. The second batch of sugar cookies is made on Thursday.
Question: If the number of batches made on Friday is exactly one, then which one of the following could be true?
Choices:
  A: The first batch of sugar cookies is made on Monday.
  B: The first batch of oatmeal cookies is made on Tuesday.
  C: The third batch of oatmeal cookies is made on Friday.
  D: The first batch of peanut butter cookies is made on Wednesday.
  E: The second batch of peanut butter cookies is made on Tuesday.
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
No reflection information provided.

Thought:
Since only one batch is made on Friday, and each kind of cookie has three batches, that means that each kind of cookie must have one batch made on either Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday.
Since at least one batch is made on Monday, and no two batches of the same kind of cookie are made on the same day, the first batch of sugar cookies cannot be made on Monday (A is incorrect).
The second batch of oatmeal cookies is made on the same day as the first batch of peanut butter cookies, so they cannot both be made on Tuesday (E is incorrect).
The second batch of sugar cookies is made on Thursday, so the third batch of oatmeal cookies cannot be made on Friday (C is incorrect).
The first batch of peanut butter cookies cannot be made on Wednesday, because that would mean that both the second batch of oatmeal cookies and the first batch of peanut butter cookies would have to be made on Thursday, which is not possible since no two batches of the same kind of cookie are made on the same day (D is incorrect).
Therefore, the first batch of oatmeal cookies must be made on Tuesday (B).
Action: Answer("B")
